title: Slow Looking: Language of Beauty (January 20)
title_display: Slow Looking: The Language of Beauty in African Art
short_description: This facilitated conversation invites participants to experience The Language of Beauty in African Art and share ideas, questions, and reactions with others.
header_description: In this facilitated conversation, visitors are invited to spend time in The Language of Beauty in African Art and share questions and observations among each other and scholars from our staff who can offer researched social and historical context.
list_description: This facilitated conversation invites participants to experience The Language of Beauty in African Art and share ideas, questions, and reactions with others.
description:
Chair and curator of the Arts of Africa Constantine Petridis describes this exhibition as “an exploration that seeks to decolonize the Western aesthetic standards long placed on these objects and to elevate the local indigenous perspectives of the works’ makers and communities.” By making space for new conversations, this Slow Looking conversation attempts to disrupt whatever preconceived notions we bring to the exhibition while pushing ourselves to think in unfamiliar and even uncomfortable ways. How might disruption ultimately inspire fresh appreciation for the nuance and power of the vast history of art from the largest continent in the world?

Please note that this will be a seated program.
